item.title: imf chief back to jail in hotel sex case
item.description: the head of the international monetary fund must remain jailed at least until friday, the day of his next court hearing for attempted rape.

item.title: china to improve nuclear safety
item.description: chinese nuclear power plant operators will work on ways to respond to multiple accidents that occur at the same time and strengthen flood control plans.

item.title: miniature train derails at park, killing 6-year-old child
item.description: a miniature train at a south carolina park derailed and overturned on saturday, killing a 6-year-old child and injuring at least 18 other people, authorities said.

item.title: reaction to manchester united-chelsea
item.description: postgame reaction after manchester united essentially won the premier league title with a 2-1 victory over chelsea at old trafford.

item.title: fda warns of drug scams that play on radiation fear
item.description: many ads on the internet for "anti-radiation" pills may be scams by hucksters seeking to profit from the japan nuclear scare, the fda warned ...

item.title: 2012 audi a7: sexy, sleek, satisfying
item.description: audi crafts a sleek hathback body onto its a6 sedan and comes up with the gorgeous, quick, comfy a7.

item.title: as citi revives, pandit wins big pay package
item.description: after a token pay of just $1 a year, citigroup's chief executive, vikram s. pandit, will earn $23.2 million if he meets certain goals.

item.title: g.m. reports earnings tripled in first quarter, as revenue jumped 15%
item.description: first-quarter net income was $3.2 billion, or $1.77 a share, one of g.m.'s best performances since the early 2000s. quarterly revenue rose nearly 15 percent to $36.2 billion.

item.title: mets to try to convince isringhausen to stay
item.description: manager terry collins said he would meet with jason isringhausen on wednesday to try to convince him to remain in florida for extended spring training.

item.title: rapper attends white house event despite criticism
item.description: despite the best efforts of right-wing pundits and contradicting earlier reports, controversial rapper common went through with his white house appearance at michelle obama's poetry event wednesday.

item.title: husband sentenced to 18 years for bathtub shooting of wife
item.description: an upstate new york man was sentenced to 18 years in prison on wednesday for the attempted murder of his wife whom he shot four times as she sat in a bath tub, authorities said.

item.title: imagining a harvard-yale merger
item.description: peering into her crystal ball, a writer imagines the two ivies' continuing to reject almost all who apply, but with tuition too high for anyone to come.

item.title: willie nelson off the hook on pot charge
item.description: when willie nelson is on the road again, he will be traveling without a texas drug charge hanging over his head.

item.title: the statue of liberty holds its own against las vegas facsimiles
item.description: compared with the original, lady liberty at a las vegas casino appears much pout-ier, far more sultry and frankly, sexy. it probably is not what fr??d??ric auguste bartholdi had in mind.

item.description: phoebe snow, a bluesy singer, guitarist and songwriter who had a defining hit of the 1970s with poetry man but then largely dropped out of the ...

item.title: egypt protests go on, seeking new beginning
item.description: in government ministries, factories and universities, protests have focused on those viewed as surrogates of hosni mubarak.

item.title: on soccer: manchester united shows wealth of talent
item.description: goals by ryan giggs and wayne rooney carried united to a one-sided victory in a champions league semifinal opener.

item.title: sidebar: weighing the place of a judge in a club of 600 white men
item.description: a panel that hears misconduct complaints about federal judges in the sixth circuit said a bankruptcy judge could keep his membership at belle meade, an exclusive nashville club.

item.title: chris young pitches again but uncertainty remains
item.description: chris young came off the disabled list and gave a mixed performance, but reported no pain in his right shoulder.

item.title: founders now take the money and maintain control
item.description: as investors chase after the latest social network start-ups, company founders are in a better position to keep control and get rich while still attracting investors to their company.

item.title: diet coke deposes pepsi as no. 2 soda in u.s.
item.description: diet coke overtook pepsi-cola in 2010 as the no. 2 soda in the united states behind coca-cola, marking the first time a diet soda has ever risen to such prominence.

item.title: on basketball: nets' dreams under construction
item.description: the nets will soon move to brooklyn, and the organization is hoping the star point guard deron williams is willing to stick around.

item.description: jay triano will not return as toronto raptors coach next season.

item.title: egypt seals $3 billion imf accord
item.description: the international monetary fund (imf) agreed to a $3 billion financing deal with egypt on sunday and praised the policies of an interim government struggling to stabilize the economy after the popular uprising.

item.title: apple delays ipad 2 launch in japan
item.description: apple inc said it will delay the launch of the ipad 2 tablet computer in japan, in the wake of last week's earthquake and tsunami.

item.title: lakers hopeful of appointing brown as head coach
item.description: the los angeles lakers hope to appoint mike brown as head coach "within the next few days" to succeed hall of famer phil jackson, the nba champions said on wednesday.

item.description: rajon rondo's miserable march is over.

item.title: southwest: arizona: judge rules against maricopa deputies
item.description: a federal judge ruled that police violated the constitutional rights of an american citizen and his father when deputies stopped their truck and took them to a business where an immigration raid was under way.

item.description: levi strauss will pay more than $1 million to almost 600 workers to settle charges of wages and hours violations.

item.description: the big east conference's depth is on display in this year's 68-team n.c.a.a. tournament field.

item.title: toronto's bautista stays on fire with three homers for jays
item.description: toronto slugger jose bautista continued his red-hot form by hitting three home runs in the blue jays' 11-3 rout over the minnesota twins sunday.

item.title: veteran russian journalist beaten in moscow
item.description: veteran reporter sergei topol was beaten up in central moscow wednesday as he was leaving his flat, police said, underlining russia's position as one of the most dangerous places in the world for journalists.

item.title: residents flee as major alaska wildfire grows
item.description: all residents near an expanding wildfire near fairbanks have fled, making way for firefighters to combat the blaze, officials said on wednesday.

item.description: debris from splintered homes covered the ground in neighborhoods around st. louis.

item.title: ftc settles with google over buzz roll-out
item.description: search giant google inc has settled with u.s. regulators investigating privacy problems that cropped up in its botched roll-out of social network buzz, the federal trade commission said on wednesday.

item.description: a 5-4 decision may prevent suits by people who object to tax credits for religious programs.

item.description: a hard-line publication called on security forces on wednesday to arrest president mahmoud ahmadinejad's closest political aide amid a widening political power struggle.

item.description: a man wearing a fake explosive belt was arrested in amman on monday after he entered the offices of an islamic opposition party and threatened to blow himself up.

item.description: regulators on friday shut two banks in georgia, lifting to 42 the number of bank failures this year.

item.title: keillor plans to leave the 'prairie'
item.description: garrison keillor, the long-time host of "a prairie home companion" told interviewers that he plans to retire in the spring of 2013.

item.title: european union's budget proposal stokes anger
item.description: a proposal seeking 4.9 percent more money in a time of widespread belt-tightening stirred up some of the bloc's member states.

item.title: dimming optimism for today's youth
item.description: for the first time on record, most americans say they do not believe today's youth will have better lives than their parents, according to new survey data from gallup.

item.title: for schwarzenegger and shriver, a transition and a separation
item.description: many californians wondered what the governor and his wife would do when he left office. whatever it is, it appears it will not be together.

item.title: sony: no date yet for playstation network return
item.description: sony corp said it would take at least "a few more days" to restore service to its online playstation network, which was breached by hackers in one of the largest internet break-ins of all time.

item.title: sister of russian airport bomber freed: reports
item.description: russian authorities have dropped all charges against the teenage sister of a suicide bomber who killed 37 people at the country's busiest airport this year, media reported on thursday,

item.title: idaho lawmakers vote to ban abortion after 20 weeks
item.description: the idaho legislature on tuesday gave final approval to a measure that would outlaw abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy and subject abortion providers to criminal prosecution and civil lawsuits.

item.title: floods affect more than 30,000 in brazil
item.description: floods in southern and southeastern brazil have forced about 31,000 people to leave their homes, authorities said monday.

item.description: they are known as the bench mob, and the mentality is creating havoc for opponents in the playoffs.

item.description: the zagat theory of the universe now rules the universe: "the shared opinions of thousands of avid consumers with real experiences are inherently more accurate than the opinions of just one or two critics."

item.title: a trial run for school standards that encourage deeper thought
item.description: about 100 new york schools are experimenting with curriculum requirements known as the 'common core' to better prepare students to take on college work.

item.title: tech firms look to grow government ties for space work
item.description: u.s. government spending on defense and space is coming under pressure, but some technology companies are finding ways to find new business by providing data services to defense and civil agencies.

item.title: u.n. war crimes panel overstepped its mandate: sri lanka
item.description: a panel advising the u.n. secretary-general on accountability for the bloody end of sri lanka's war overstepped its mandate by producing a investigative report concluding there are "credible allegations" of war crimes, sri lanka said on thursday.

item.title: glencore's secrecy erodes pulling power: investors
item.description: glencore, the secretive commodities trader on the cusp of a record ipo, may pay a high price for its low profile, as corporate governance fears damage its ability to achieve a top price for its stock.

item.title: signs of an urban river's revival in virginia
item.description: ten years ago, bathers in the james river, which wends through richmond, va., wore ear and nose plugs to stave off infections from sewage runoff. now, the river is stalked by blue herons and shad.

item.title: crews try to protect arizona communities from fires
item.description: crews worked to protect several small communities from two large wildfires by clearing away brush and planning fires aimed at robbing the blazes of their fuel.

item.title: unusual trade in apple shares canceled: exchange
item.description: a single trade in apple inc shares far below where the stock had previously been priced on wednesday was canceled, said a spokesperson at the exchange where it was generated.

item.description: u-prince - the united nations and united states on friday questioned some of haiti's legislative election results announced this week, saying they had detected unexplained changes that favored the ruling inite party.

item.description: lawmakers criticize sony for its actions in the aftermath of breaches of its playstation network and sony online entertainment service.

item.title: eu urges radiation tests on japanese food imports
item.description: the european union's executive arm has advised eu governments to check levels of radioactivity in food and feed imports from japan, following the country's nuclear crisis.

item.title: soundgarden sets summer reunion tour of north america
item.description: more than a year after they announced their reunion, the members of seattle rock band soundgarden said on thursday they would tour north america for the first time in almost 15 years during the summer.

item.description: some 2,100 quebec fans are expected to travel april 10 to prudential center in newark for the season-ending game between the devils and the boston bruins.

item.title: a village with the numbers, not the image, of the poorest place

item.description: pope benedict led the world's catholics into easter on saturday, ahead of the beatification of his venerated predecessor john paul ii on may 1.

item.description: a judge ruled that domenico dolce and stefano gabbana would not have to stand trial on charges of tax evasion and fraud.

item.title: raytheon helps u.s. subs stay in touch

item.title: sotomayor got $1.175 million for memoir, forms reveal
item.description: on financial disclosure forms, justice clarence thomas also said his wife, virginia, received 'salary and benefits' from a conservative group she founded with ties to the tea party movement.

item.title: leading off: a sinking feeling in san jose
item.description: the sharks have one more chance not to be remembered as one of the few n.h.l. teams to blow a 3-0 playoff series lead.

item.description: a soyuz spacecraft blasted off for the international space station on wednesday with a russian, american and a japanese astronaut on board.

item.title: cheruiyot set to improve on record boston marathon pace
item.description: kenya's robert kiprono cheruiyot sounded an ominous warning to his rivals in monday's boston marathon by signaling his intent to improve on the punishing pace he set last year on the way to a course record.

item.title: humala extends lead in peru presidential race
item.description: left-wing nationalist ollanta humala has extended his lead in peru's presidential race and former prime minister pedro pablo kuczynski may now be in second place, polls showed on friday before the april 10 vote.

item.title: paul j. wiedorfer, hero of the battle of the bulge, dies at 90
item.description: mr. wiedorfer, of baltimore, took out two german machine-gun nests during the battle of the bulge in world war ii.
